Financial markets had a euphoric summer. Are they too optimistic?
subhead: Wall Street and European stock exchanges have been hitting record highs. The impact of trade tensions has been downplayed, and corporate earnings have pleasantly surprised investors. Still, valuations remain a cause for concern.

subhead: The joint statement published on August 21 by the EU and the US confirms that European spirits are now subject to a 15% import tariff when entering the American market.

title: The largest chikungunya outbreak in mainland France sparks hunt for tiger mosquito
subhead: There have been 33 locally-transmitted cases of the tropical disease in a neighborhood in the city of Vitrolles in the south of France.

title: Gangsta rap sparks controversy in Sweden
subhead: As Sweden grapples with a decade-long rise in drug-related violence, questions are mounting over whether festival organizers should continue booking the country's top gangsta rap acts.

title: The twilight of Morocco's King Mohammed VI
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (1/6). Twenty-six years after his 1999 coronation, the Moroccan monarch's relationship to power remains complex. As questions about his health arise, the prospect of his succession is fueling power struggles and backroom deals among the country's elite.

Is 'abundance' the new watchword of US Democrats?
subhead: Born in California, the concept of 'abundance' has captivated the centrist wing of the Democratic Party. It advocates for an interventionist state paired with deregulation to facilitate investment and increase the supply of essential goods such as housing, energy, transportation and healthcare.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Spike in suspicious incidents in Iran fuels fears of a simmering war
subhead: Iranians remain on edge two months after the end of the 12-day war, worried about renewed fighting with Israel and burdened by inflation and water and power shortages.

title: The mysteries of actress Isabelle Adjani's vocation
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (1/6). Nothing seemed to predestine her to become one of the greatest stars of French cinema. Yet the young actress, born to an Algerian father and a German mother, experienced a meteoric rise. She made her debut on stage at barely 17 years old and quickly transitioned to film.
